description: Square lets developers build an ecosystem for businesses to seamlessly accept payments online, in store, or on the go.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to obtain accessToken from SquareECommerce.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Square ECommerce.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Square ECommerce.

args.name: code
args.info: Required: Authorization code.

blocks.name: refreshAccessToken
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to renew acceesToken.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Square ECommerce.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Square ECommerce.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained from getAccessToken method.

blocks.name: revokeSingleAccessToken
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to revoke an access token generated with the OAuth flow.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Square ECommerce.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Square ECommerce.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: accessToken obtained from getAccessToken method.

blocks.name: revokeTokens
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to revoke all merchant's access tokens.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Required: API key obtained from Square ECommerce.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Required: API secret  obtained from Square ECommerce.

args.name: merchantId
args.info: Required: The ID of the merchant whose token you want to revoke.

blocks.name: getLocations
blocks.description: This endpoint provides the details for all of a business's locations.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

blocks.name: chargeCard
blocks.description: Charges a card represented by a card nonce or a customer's card on file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: locationId
args.info: Required: The ID of the location to associate the created transaction with.

args.name: idempotencyKey
args.info: Required: A value you specify that uniquely identifies this transaction among transactions you've created.

args.name: amount
args.info: Required: The amount of money to charge.

args.name: currency
args.info: Required: The type of currency, in ISO 4217 format. For example, the currency code for US dollars is USD. The value of currency must match the currency associated with the business that is charging the card.

args.name: cardNonce
args.info: Optional: A nonce generated from the SqPaymentForm that represents the card to charge. The application that provides a nonce to this endpoint must be the same application that generated the nonce with the SqPaymentForm. Otherwise, the nonce is invalid.Do not provide a value for this field if you provide a value for customer_card_id.

args.name: customerCardId
args.info: Optional: The ID of the customer card on file to charge. Do not provide a value for this field if you provide a value for card_nonce.

args.name: delayCapture
args.info: Optional: If true, the request will only perform an Auth on the provided card. Default value: false

args.name: referenceId
args.info: Optional: An optional ID you can associate with the transaction for your own purposes (such as to associate the transaction with an entity ID in your own database). This value cannot exceed 40 characters.

args.name: note
args.info: Optional: An optional note to associate with the transaction. This value cannot exceed 60 characters.

args.name: customerId
args.info: Optional: The ID of the customer to associate this transaction with. This field is required if you provide a value for customer_card_id, and optional otherwise.

args.name: buyerEmailAddress
args.info: Optional: The buyer's email address, if available.

args.name: billingAddressLine1
args.info: Optional: The first line of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingAddressLine2
args.info: Optional: The second line of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingAddressLine3
args.info: Optional: The third line of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingLocality
args.info: Optional: The city or town of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingSublocality
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's locality of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingSublocality2
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's sublocality of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingSublocality3
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's sublocality2 of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingAdministrativeDistrictLevel1
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's country of the buyer's billing address. In the US, this is the state.

args.name: billingAdministrativeDistrictLevel2
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's administrative_district_level_1 of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingAdministrativeDistrictLevel3
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's administrative_district_level_2 of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingPostalCode
args.info: Optional: The billing address's postal code.

args.name: billingCountry
args.info: Optional: The billing address's country, in ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format.

args.name: shippingAddressLine1
args.info: Optional: The first line of the buyer's shipping address.

args.name: shippingAddressLine2
args.info: Optional: The second line of the buyer's shipping address.

args.name: shippingAddressLine3
args.info: Optional: The third line of the buyer's shipping address.

args.name: shippingLocality
args.info: Optional: The city or town of the buyer's shipping address.

args.name: shippingSublocality
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's locality of the buyer's shipping address.

args.name: shippingSublocality2
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's sublocality of the buyer's shipping address.

args.name: shippingSublocality3
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's sublocality2 of the buyer's shipping address.

args.name: shippingAdministrativeDistrictLevel1
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's country of the buyer's shipping address. In the US, this is the state.

args.name: shippingAdministrativeDistrictLevel2
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's administrative_district_level_1 of the buyer's shipping address.

args.name: shippingAdministrativeDistrictLevel3
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's administrative_district_level_2 of the buyer's shipping address.

args.name: shippingPostalCode
args.info: Optional: The shipping address's postal code.

args.name: shippingCountry
args.info: Optional: The shipping address's country, in ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format.

blocks.name: getTransactions
blocks.description: This endpoint returns lists transactions for a particular location.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: locationId
args.info: Required: The ID of the location to list transactions for.

args.name: beginTime
args.info: Optional: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format (2016-01-31T00:00:00Z). Default value: The current time minus one year.

args.name: endTime
args.info: Optional: The end of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format (2016-01-31T00:00:00Z). Default value: The current time.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: Optional: The order in which results are listed in the response (ASC for oldest first, DESC for newest first). Default value: DESC

args.name: cursor
args.info: Optional: A pagination cursor returned by a previous call to this endpoint. Provide this to retrieve the next set of results for your original query.

blocks.name: captureSingleTransaction
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to capture a transaction that was created with the Charge endpoint with a delay_capture value of true.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: locationId
args.info: Required: The ID of the location to list transactions for.

args.name: transactionId
args.info: Required: The ID of the transaction.

blocks.name: voidSingleTransaction
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to cancel a transaction that was created with the Charge endpoint with a delay_capture value of true.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: locationId
args.info: Required: The ID of the location to list transactions for.

args.name: transactionId
args.info: Required: The ID of the transaction.

blocks.name: retrieveSingleTransaction
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to retrieve details for a single transaction.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: locationId
args.info: Required: The ID of the location to list transactions for.

args.name: transactionId
args.info: Required: The ID of the transaction.

blocks.name: createRefund
blocks.description: This endpoint allows to create a refund

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: locationId
args.info: Required: The ID of the original transaction's associated location.

args.name: transactionId
args.info: Required: The ID of the original transaction that includes the tender to refund.

args.name: idempotencyKey
args.info: Required: A value you specify that uniquely identifies this refund among refunds you've created for the tender.

args.name: tenderId
args.info: Required: The ID of the tender to refund.

args.name: amount
args.info: Required: The amount of money, in the lowest in the smallest denomination of the currency indicated by currency. For example, when currency_code is USD, amount is in cents.

args.name: currency
args.info: Required: The type of currency, in ISO 4217 format. For example, the currency code for US dollars is USD.

args.name: reason
args.info: Optional: A description of the reason for the refund. Default value: Refund via API

blocks.name: getRefunds
blocks.description: This endpoint returns lists refunds for one of a business's locations.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: locationId
args.info: Required: The ID of the location to list refunds for.

args.name: beginTime
args.info: Optional: The beginning of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format (2016-01-31T00:00:00Z). Default value: The current time minus one year.

args.name: endTime
args.info: Optional: The end of the requested reporting period, in RFC 3339 format (2016-01-31T00:00:00Z). Default value: The current time.

args.name: sortOrder
args.info: Optional: The order in which results are listed in the response (ASC for oldest first, DESC for newest first). Default value: DESC

args.name: cursor
args.info: Optional: A pagination cursor returned by a previous call to this endpoint. Provide this to retrieve the next set of results for your original query.

blocks.name: createCustomer
blocks.description: This endpoint creates a new customer for a business, which can have associated cards on file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: givenName
args.info: Optional: The customer's given (i.e., first) name.

args.name: familyName
args.info: Optional: The customer's family (i.e., last) name.

args.name: companyName
args.info: Optional: The name of the customer's company.

args.name: nickname
args.info: Optional: A nickname for the customer.

args.name: email
args.info: Optional: The customer's email address.

args.name: phoneNumber
args.info: Optional: The customer's phone number.

args.name: referenceId
args.info: Optional: An optional second ID you can set to associate the customer with an entity in another system.

args.name: note
args.info: Optional: An optional note to associate with the customer.

args.name: addressLine1
args.info: Optional: The first line of the address.

args.name: addressLine2
args.info: Optional: The second line of the address, if any.

args.name: addressLine3
args.info: Optional: The third line of the address, if any.

args.name: addressLocality
args.info: Optional: The city or town of the address.

args.name: addressSublocality
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's locality, if any.

args.name: addressSublocality2
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's sublocality, if any.

args.name: addressSublocality3
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's sublocality2, if any.

args.name: addressAdministrativeDistrictLevel1
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's country. In the US, this is the state.

args.name: addressAdministrativeDistrictLevel2
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's administrative_district_level_1. In the US, this is the county.

args.name: addressAdministrativeDistrictLevel3
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's administrative_district_level_2, if any.

args.name: addressPostalCode
args.info: Optional: The address's postal code.

args.name: addressCountry
args.info: Optional: The address's country, in ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format.

blocks.name: getCustomers
blocks.description: This endpoint returns lists a business's customers.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: cursor
args.info: Optional: A pagination cursor returned by a previous call to this endpoint. Provide this to retrieve the next set of results for your original query.

blocks.name: updateCustomer
blocks.description: This endpoint updates the details of an existing customer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: customerId
args.info: Required: The ID of the customer to update.

args.name: givenName
args.info: Optional: The customer's given (i.e., first) name.

args.name: familyName
args.info: Optional: The customer's family (i.e., last) name.

args.name: companyName
args.info: Optional: The name of the customer's company.

args.name: nickname
args.info: Optional: A nickname for the customer.

args.name: email
args.info: Optional: The customer's email address.

args.name: phoneNumber
args.info: Optional: The customer's phone number.

args.name: referenceId
args.info: Optional: An optional second ID you can set to associate the customer with an entity in another system.

args.name: note
args.info: Optional: An optional note to associate with the customer.

args.name: addressLine1
args.info: Optional: The first line of the address.

args.name: addressLine2
args.info: Optional: The second line of the address, if any.

args.name: addressLine3
args.info: Optional: The third line of the address, if any.

args.name: addressLocality
args.info: Optional: The city or town of the address.

args.name: addressSublocality
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's locality, if any.

args.name: addressSublocality2
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's sublocality, if any.

args.name: addressSublocality3
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's sublocality2, if any.

args.name: addressAdministrativeDistrictLevel1
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's country. In the US, this is the state.

args.name: addressAdministrativeDistrictLevel2
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's administrative_district_level_1. In the US, this is the county.

args.name: addressAdministrativeDistrictLevel3
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's administrative_district_level_2, if any.

args.name: addressPostalCode
args.info: Optional: The address's postal code.

args.name: addressCountry
args.info: Optional: The address's country, in ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format.

blocks.name: getSingleCustomer
blocks.description: This endpoint returns details for a single customer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: customerId
args.info: Required: The ID of the customer to retrieve.

blocks.name: createCustomerCard
blocks.description: Adds a card on file to an existing customer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: customerId
args.info: Required: The ID of the customer to link the card on file to.

args.name: cardNonce
args.info: Required: A card nonce representing the credit card to link to the customer.

args.name: cardholderName
args.info: Optional: The cardholder's name.

args.name: billingAddressLine1
args.info: Optional: The first line of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingAddressLine2
args.info: Optional: The second line of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingAddressLine3
args.info: Optional: The third line of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingLocality
args.info: Optional: The city or town of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingSublocality
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's locality of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingSublocality2
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's sublocality of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingSublocality3
args.info: Optional: A civil region within the address's sublocality2 of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingAdministrativeDistrictLevel1
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's country of the buyer's billing address. In the US, this is the state.

args.name: billingAdministrativeDistrictLevel2
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's administrative_district_level_1 of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingAdministrativeDistrictLevel3
args.info: Optional: A civil entity within the address's administrative_district_level_2 of the buyer's billing address.

args.name: billingPostalCode
args.info: Optional: The billing address's postal code.

args.name: billingCountry
args.info: Optional: The billing address's country, in ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 format.

blocks.name: deleteCustomerCard
blocks.description: This endpoint removes a card on file from a customer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: customerId
args.info: Required: The ID of the customer to delete.

args.name: cardId
args.info: Required: The ID of the card on file to delete.

blocks.name: deleteSingleCustomer
blocks.description: This endpoint deletes a customer from a business, along with any linked cards on file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Required: Valid AccessToken.

args.name: customerId
args.info: Required: The ID of the customer to delete.
